Sequence Information.Peptide Name: MtDef4_V6 (triple substitution variant L15R16R17; synthetic AMPs20a, UCSS1a; 4S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution,  plant-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (97.87%) toMtDef4_V5C: 17%, R: 19%. The A15L change made V6 more hydrophobic.Activity: active against B. cinerea (MIC 6 uM).Recombinant production:yeast:Pichia pastoris:  activity tested using recombinant peptide.Antimicrobial robustness: KCl-insensitive:B. cinerea (100 mM), CaCl2-insensitive:B. cinerea (2 mM). The creation of a cationic surface via mutations made the peptide more competitive than cation in bacterial targeting.Plant protection:N. benthamiana: MtDef4_V6 was more potent in reducing lesions formed by the grey mould disease than either MtDef4 or MtDef4_V5.
Literature Information.Author: Li H, Kalunke R, Tetorya M, Czymmek KJ, Shah DM.2024
Literature Information.Title: Modes of action and potential as a peptide-based biofungicide of a plant defensin MtDef4
